intro: Prestelia, commonly known as the "rain plant," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent characteristics. The plant features fleshy, water-storing leaves that help it survive in arid environments. Its flowers, often yellow or orange, bloom after rainfall and are short-lived. Prestelia is prized for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
